dataStructures.title: Decentralized data structures
dataStructures.description: The decentralized web relies on unique data structures and linking strategies. Learn about the benefits of hashing, content addressing, DAG and Merkle Trees!

resources.title: Decentralized Web Primer: The Power of Content-Addressing
resources.description: A beginner-friendly primer on content addressing from Matt Zumwalt.

resources.title: The Next Internet Revolution (Excerpt)
resources.description: In this excerpt from his TedX Talk, Juan Benet explains how the Interplanetary File System (IPFS) reframes our model for sharing knowledge.

resources.title: Why is Decentralized and Distributed File Storage Critical for a Better Web?
resources.description: Juan Benet, Jesse Clayburgh, and Matt Zumwalt of Protocol Labs explain how advances in distributed data storage and strong alignment of market incentives are combining to create a much more secure and efficient web.

resources.title: Instructions for Saving Endangered Data
resources.description: Matt Zumwalt of IPFS explains why data isn't safe on the centralized web and how IPFS can be used to protect it.

resources.title: HTTP is Obsolete. It's Time for the Distributed, Permanent Web.
resources.description: Kyle Drake of Neocities explores the downsides of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP).
